issue.title: Fix #10449, buffer.getBytes(...) not change a file channel position

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Regression appeared after making changes in fix #10360 .
The main problem here that `buffer.getBytes(buffer.readerIndex(), fileChannel, fileChannel.position(), localsize)`
doesn't change channel position after writes.

Modification:

Manually set position according to the written bytes.

Result:

Fixes #10449 .

body: Hi, guys could you please check fix.
This affected us as well (is still working properly with `4.1.50.Final`), when can we expect `4.1.52.Final`? We're getting an OOM, the async allocation flames we're seeing look like the following:

issue.title: whick highest version is support for jdk1.7

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
### Expected behavior

When I upload a big file (more than 100 kb), the `FileUpload.getFile()` return a size of 16 kb File on jdk1.7, but it's ok on jdk1.8
so I want to know what's the highest `Netty` version supported for jdk1.7 ?
So kind of you all! Thanks .

### Actual behavior

### Steps to reproduce

with url http://127.0.0.1/version/add to upload a big file

### Minimal yet complete reproducer code (or URL to code)

https://github.com/github-big-cheng/upgrade.git

### Netty version

4.1.51.Final
4.1.10.Final

### JVM version (e.g. `java -version`)

jdk 1.7 / 1.8

### OS version (e.g. `uname -a`)

windows 10

body: @paplorinc sorry it took longer then expected but within the next week.
